H0.text: Conduction is the transfer of heat by physical contact.

H1.text: Oxidation is the transfer of heat by physical contact.

H2.text: Inhibition is the transfer of heat by physical contact.

H3.text: Diffusion is the transfer of heat by physical contact.

A4.text: Conduction is the most significant means of heat transfer within a solid or between solid objects in thermal contact.

A5.text: Heat conduction is the direct microscopic exchanges of kinetic energy of particles (such as molecules) or quasiparticles (such as lattice waves) through the boundary between two systems.
